definition: Reagan (name)/Ronald Reagan (1911-2004), US president (1981-1989)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Li (surname)
lining/interior/inside/internal/also written 裏|里[li3]
variant of 裡|里[li3]
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: At no time, though, did Reagan ever criticize the United Nations specifically.
sentences.chinese: 但里根从未对联合国提出过明确的批评。

sentences.english: Also for her right-wing, pro-corporate alliance with US President Regan.
sentences.chinese: 还为她右翼，有利于企业联盟与美国总统里根。

sentences.english: The only president not to parade down Pennsylvania Avenue was Ronald Reagan.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的总统不跌宾夕法尼亚大道的游行是罗纳德里根。

sentences.english: What is Ronald Reagan going to be remembered by? One line: 'Mr.
sentences.chinese: 人们将通过哪句记住里根呢？

sentences.english: The hematoma lay between the dural and the brain.
sentences.chinese: 里根脑血肿的部位处于硬脑膜与脑实质之间。

sentences.english: First, we must break out of the Reagan-era straitjacket concerning taxes and regulation.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我们要打破里根时代关于税收和监管的老观念。

sentences.english: Have faith, Mr. Reagan asked his party and his country.
sentences.chinese: 里根对他的政党和国家的要求是坚守信念。

sentences.english: Mondale ended up losing the election in a landslide to Ronald Reagan.
sentences.chinese: 蒙代尔最后惨败给里根。

sentences.english: Mr Reagan brings with him some heavy ideological baggage.
sentences.chinese: 里根先生则带有一些沉重的思想包袱。

sentences.english: A generation ago, President Reagan proposed research intoa global shield to defend against ballistic missiles.
sentences.chinese: 一代人之前，里根总统提议研究弹道导弹防御系统。

sentences.english: Would Reagan offer Ford a co-presidency in 1980?
sentences.chinese: 难道里根会在1980年向福特提议联合执政？

sentences.english: The linchpin phrase that Reagan insisted upon was “trust but verify.”
sentences.chinese: 里根坚持使用的关键词语是“信任但要核实”。

sentences.english: In February, Reagan upped the ante.
sentences.chinese: 当年2月，里根加大了赌注。
卡里根的协调技能相当高超。

sentences.english: Reaganism reversed a century-long trend toward ever-larger government.
sentences.chinese: 里根主义扭转了政府越来越大的趋势。

sentences.english: In the back were all the tools Carrigan needed to commit his next crime.
sentences.chinese: 可在修理铺后面卡里根藏着所有下次作案的工具。

definition: Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Thatcher (name)/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Bush (name)/George H.W. Bush (1924-2018), US president 1988-1992/George W. Bush (1946-), US President 2000-2008
Kennedy (name)/J.F. Kennedy (1917-1963), US Democrat politician, president 1961-1963
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
Richard Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974/surname Nixon
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Donald Trump (1946-), American business magnate, US president 2017-
George Washington (1732-1799), first US president
Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
McCain (name)/John McCain (1936-2018), US Republican politician, Senator for Arizona 1987-2018
Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
Brzezinski (name)/Zbigniew Brzezinski (1928-2017), Polish-American academic and politician, US National Security Adviser 1977-1981
Chester William Nimitz (1885-1966), US admiral
Barack Obama (1961-), US Democrat politician, president 2009-2017
